titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Works Progress Administration Historical Records Survey, 1936-1942 (bulk 1936-1937)
Works Progress Administration Historical Records Survey
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Buffalo History Museum staff.
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for the initial encoding was provided through the Regional Bibliographic Databases Program administered by the Western New York Library Resources Council.

publicationstmt.p: © 2010. Buffalo History Museum. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by Isidor Justeson, April 2008.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using local best practices.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Works Progress Administration Historical Records Survey
did.abstract: Survey forms, field notes, bulletins and correspondence for a survey of state and local historical records (government and church records, manuscripts, maps and photographs) conducted initially by the State Historical Society but after 1935 by the Works Progress Administration.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Description and dates], Box/folder number, Mss. C77-6, Works Progress Administration Historical Records Survey, 1936-1942 (bulk 1936-1937), Research Library, Buffalo History Museum Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Works Progress Administration Historical Records Survey, 1936-1942, is open for research.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright of papers in the collection may be held by their authors, or the authors' heirs or assigns. Researchers must obtain the written permission of the holder(s) of copyright and the Buffalo History Museum before publishing quotations from materials in the collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Please see librarian for acquisition information.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection reprocessed and retroconverted by Peter Nelson, 14 April 1992.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Works Progress Administration of the New Deal conducted the Historical Records Survey from 1935-1943. Its mission was "discovery, preservation, and listing of basic materials for research in the history of the United States."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Survey forms, field notes, bulletins and correspondence for a survey of state and local historical records (government and church records, manuscripts, maps and photographs) conducted initially by the State Historical Society but after 1935 by the Works Progress Administration. New York counties covered are Allegany, Cattaraugus, Chautauqua, Erie, Genesee, Niagara, Orleans and Wyoming.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in five series:
I. Survey Records by Country
II. Maps and Photographs By County
III. Manuscript Collections (Libraries and Museums)
IV. Church Records Inventory
V. Works Progress Administration Administrative Files.
Alphabetical arrangement by county, then by city or town.
